@soumith @apaszke if it helps, this even simpler code (using @soumith's simplification of the bug only being dependent on the .backward(create_graph=True)) leaks as well:

x = torch.autograd.Variable(torch.ones(1).cuda(), requires_grad=True)
for rep in range(1000000):
  (x*x).backward(create_graph=True)

It at least removes the idea that Modules could be the problem.
body:
@soumith @apaszke if it helps, this even simpler code (using @soumith's simplification of the bug only being dependent on the `.backward(create_graph=True)`) leaks as well:

```
x = torch.autograd.Variable(torch.ones(1).cuda(), requires_grad=True)
for rep in range(1000000):
  (x*x).backward(create_graph=True)
```

It at least removes the idea that `Module`s could be the problem.
